tit.e: Homyo-jiku (a hanging scroll on which a priest's name or posthumous name of the deceased is drawn)
tit.cmt: 用語登録では "homyo jiku, homyo（priest's name or posthumous Buddhist name）hanging scroll"となっています。
tit.e: Homyo-jiku (a hanging scroll on which a priest's name or the posthumous name of the deceased is drawn)

sen.j: 法名軸（ほうみょうじく）とは、浄土真宗において用いられる仏具で、法名 (浄土真宗)を記す掛軸。
sen.e: Homyo-jiku is one of Buddhist alter fittings used in Jodo Shinshu (the True Pure Land School of Buddhism,) on which homyo (a priest's name or posthumous name of the deceased) is described or painted.

sen.j: 法名軸は、位牌のように礼拝の対象としない。
sen.e: Homyo-jiku is not regarded as an object of worship like ihai (a Buddhist mortuary tablet.)
Unlike ihai (a Buddhist mortuary tablet), homyo-jiku is not considered an object of worship.

sen.j: 在家の御内仏の場合、仏壇の内側の両側面に掛けて荘厳する。
sen.e: For a household altar of lay believers, homyo-jiku are hung solemnly on both inner sides of the altar.
sen.cmt: 用語登録では、「御内仏」は"Onaibutsu (another name for butsudan)"となっています。

sen.j: 真宗高田派では、法名軸は用いず、位牌を用いる（礼拝の対象ではない）。
sen.e: Shinshu Takada-ha (the Takada sect of Shinshu Buddhist school) does not use homyo-jiku but ihai (a mortuary tablet,) which is, however, not regarded as an object of worship in this sect.
sen.cmt: 用語登録では、「真宗高田派」は"Shinshu Takada sect"となっています。
sen.e: Shinshu Takada-ha (the Takada sect of the Shinshu Buddhist school) does not use homyo-jiku but uses ihai (a mortuary tablet), which is, however, not considered an object of worship in this sect.

sen.j: 形状は、金襴・緞子などでできた掛軸の中央に白無地の紙を表装したもの。
sen.e: Homyo-jiku is shaped in a hanging scroll made of gold brocades and damasks with white plain paper mounted at the center on it.

sen.j: 罫線を引き複数名が記せるようにしたものを、合幅と呼び、総法名軸として用いる。
sen.e: When the paper has ruled lines to enable more than one name be written, it is called "awase-haba" (literally, "conjunction of widths,") and is used for so-homyo-jiku (a homyo-jiku to cover all homyo names concerned.)

sen.j: 仏具店などで法名軸を購入して用意するか、手次寺（他宗でいう菩提寺）の住職に用意してもらう。
sen.e: You may purchase a homyo-jiku at any shop of articles for Buddhist altars, or request the chief priest of your o-tetsugi-dera temple (an ancestral temple of Jodo Shinshu school, equivalent to a bodai-ji temple of other schools) to prepare it.

sen.j: 四十九日までに住職に法名を書き写してもらう。
sen.e: Then, you may ask the chief priest to transcribe the homyo of the deceased person onto the paper of homyo-jiku within forty-nine days after his or her death.

sen.j: また、過去帳を持っている場合は、同時に記載してもらう。
sen.e: If you are keeping kakocho (a death register,) you may ask the chief priest to transcribe homyo onto kakocho, too.
sen.cmt: 用語の検索・登録では、「過去帳」は"a family register of deaths"となっています。
sen.e: If you are keeping kakocho (a death register), you may also ask the chief priest to transcribe homyo onto kakocho.

sen.j: 法名軸を渡されたら、中陰壇にある「白木の位牌」は、寺に返す。
sen.e: When you receive homyo-jiku with names from the temple, you should take out "shiraki no ihai" (literally, a "mortuary tablet of plain wood") from behind the middle high platform of the altar, and hand it back to the temple.
sen.cmt: 「中陰段」の意味不詳。「中段の後側」という意味に解釈して訳しました。ちなみに、用語の検索・登録では"chuin-dan platform"となっています。

sen.j: 故人が本山より「法名 (浄土真宗)院号」を授与されていた場合は、その時に授与される「院号法名」が記された紙を、真宗専門の仏具店などで表装する。
sen.e: If the head temple of Jodo Shinshu school has already conferred homyo (posthumous name) and ingo (posthumous title) on the deceased, you must receive from the temple the paper on which these homyo and ingo have been written, and make the paper mounted on a hanging scroll at any store of Buddhist altar fittings specializing in Shinshu school.
sen.cmt: 用語の検索・登録では、「院号」は３とおりに訳されていますが、ここではいずれも該当しないと思います。単に"posthumous title"とし、「法名」を"posthumous name"として対比させました。

sen.j: 平時は、仏壇の向かって右側面に、親（もしくは直近に亡くなった人の）の法名軸を掛け、向って左側面には、代々の法名を記した総法名軸を掛ける。
sen.e: In ordinary practice, homyo-jiku of your parents (or any other person who died lately) should be hanged on the right hand side of an altar as you face, and on the left hand side, so-homyo-jiku covering all homyo names of your ancestors.

In ordinary practice, homyo-jiku of your parents (or any other person who died recently) should be hanged on the right hand side of an altar as you face it, and on the left hand side, so-homyo-jiku covering all homyo names of your ancestors.

sen.j: 側面に掛ける理由は、浄土真宗の仏壇は浄土をあらわしたものであり、故人も諸仏として、その中心にいる阿弥陀如来へ向いていると考えるからである。
sen.e: The reason why homyo-jiku are hanged on the inner sides of altar is explained as, in Jodo Shinshu school, any altar is considered to represent jodo (a pure land) where all the deceased, being treated as Buddha, are facing toward Amida Nyorai (Amidabha) in the center.

sen.j: 個々の法名軸は、平時は巻いておき（在家用の軸は、箱などに収め巻かない）、祥月命日・年忌に出し、仏壇前に掛ける。
sen.e: In ordinary days, each individual homyo-jiku is rolled up, (except for laymen's houses where homyo-jiku are not rolled up but placed in boxes,) while on the occasions of anniversaries of the death of ancestors, they are exposed to be hung in front of altars.
